html: After the archtyrant—the Sea and River (Isaiah 5:30; 8:7)—has served Jehovah’s purpose of punishing the wicked, Jehovah empowers his hand (vv 11, 14)—his mighty wind—over him. As Moses had power over Pharaoh to lead Israel out of Egypt (Isaiah 63:11-14), so the servant leads a remnant of Jehovah’s people in an exodus out of Assyria and out of all countries where they were scattered (vv 11-12; Isaiah 10:21-22; 43:16-17; Ezekiel 34:11-24). As Jehovah dried up the tongue of the Red Sea to let Israel pass over (Exodus 14:21-22; Isaiah 51:9-11), so he dries up the Assyrian tongue (Isaiah 54:16-17).
